page.title: 06 THE AMBULANCE STATION
page.content: Along the Reading Road is an ambulance station with two ambulances for use in the Wokingham area.One,like a mini bus is used to take mostly elderly people hospital for regular treatment.The other is the front line ambulance and is used to take people to hospital in cases of sudden illness,accidents at home,work and on the road.It carries strechers,oxygen,entenox gasses, splints,and other neccesary first aid equipment.The trained crew of 2 take it in turns to drive and work in 6 hour shifts.Training takes 3 months.To call an ambulance by telephone dial 999,ask the operator for an ambulance and he will connect you with the station.Then with flashing light and loud siren the ambulance goes quickly to the accident and then on to hospital.Sirens and lights are not used with patients on board.
